content.text: I'm really interested in starting a salt water aquarium.
I blog about salt water aquarium ownership.
Oh, that's great! I've been doing a lot of research, but I'm still pretty new to it.
I'm happy to help in any way I can.
What are the most important things to consider when setting up a salt water aquarium?
The most important thing is to make sure you have the right tank size and filtration system for the type of fish you want to keep.
What kind of fish do you have?
I have a few different types of fish, including clownfish, tangs, and a blue tang.
Those sound great! I've always wanted a clownfish.
They're great fish to have. They're very friendly and interactive.
I'm glad to hear that. I've heard that they're one of the best fish to have for beginners.
They are. They're not very demanding and they're easy to take care of.
That's great. I'm definitely going to look into getting one.
Awesome! I'm sure you'll love it
